This still doesn't address the said issue though. Here, the getPackagePath() method needs to be called anyway to get the module name for a given log call. These if conditions are duplicating two checks/functionalities:

The call to get the module name
The check to see if the log level is enabled (since it is checked in the logMessage() method)
timeline.author: pubudu91

replies.bodyText:
As mentioned before, it makes a considerable performance improvement when the log level is not enabled. With the new implementation, if module log level is not enabled, getPackagePath() does not have to get called in order to check if the log level is enabled. If only the log level is enabled, getPackagePath() will be called to print the log message.
Yes, agree with the second point. the check in logMessage() is not redundant since it is already confirmed that the log level is enabled. Hence removed that check.
